1.title: How to overcome our biases? Walk boldly toward them
1.subtitle: Our biases can be dangerous, even deadly — as we've seen in the cases of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, and Eric Garner, in Staten Island, New York. Diversity advocate Vernā Myers looks closely at some of the subconscious attitudes we hold toward out-groups. She makes a plea to all people: Acknowledge your biases.

1.title: Bailee's Nail Box
1.subtitle: Bailee's Nail Box is a FUN box for girls, created by 11 year old Bailee K. for girls ages 4 - 12 who love all things nails! Bailee's goal was to create memorable boxes filled with different tools for fun nail designs with an extra girly accessory with each box.

products.name: Bailee's Bundle
products.description: Two safe non-toxic polishes - Bailee's Spark & Rose Shimmer. Nail polish ring holder. All natural hand scrub, made by Bailee, that will leave your hands smooth, moisturized and exfoliated.

products.name: Christmas Scrunchie
products.description: We have a variety of different colored Christmas scrunchies! Let us send you one!

products.name: My Beauty Secret is Gratitude
products.description: You've now found the staple t-shirt of your wardrobe. It's made of a thicker, heavier cotton, but it's still soft and comfy. And the double stitching on the neckline and sleeves add more durability to what is sure to be a favorite!

2.title: Diarrablu
2.subtitle: The Diarrablu mission is to iterate for sustainability while highlighting the African continent’s rich colors and unique patterns through practical and versatile pieces designed using mathematical concepts or algorithms.

products.name: Sustainable Mailys Dress - Noir
products.description: Sustainable, artisanal and size inclusive, the Mailys Dress is easily convertible into over 19 different styles. This garment is a comfortable and versatile dress thoughtfully designed to fit all body shapes and sizes.

products.name: Headwrap - Suto
products.description: These statement pieces are part of our zero-waste sustainable approach as we believe in maximizing the usage of all our fabrics.

products.name: Hidden in Ocho Rios | Art Print
products.description: In this piece, we daydream of an impromptu retreat in Ocho Rios, Jamaica in a hidden tree-house covered in palm leaves.

2.title: How studying privilege systems can strengthen compassion
2.subtitle: Her TED Talk offers a shift in the traditional view of race, equity and privilege. McIntosh uses her own experience as a white woman to inform her own knowledge of racial experiences from a white perspective.

3.title: Juneteenth Challenges A Narrative About America’s History
3.subtitle: Juneteenth marks the day in 1865 when Union troops arrived in Galveston, Texas, and the enslaved people living there learned of their freedom — more than two years after President Abraham Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation. As such, the day tells a broader story of how emancipation was woefully delayed for Black people enslaved deep in the Confederacy.

3.title: Cultures, nations, and religions are not rocks – they’re always changing
3.subtitle: Learn more about Destiny Instinct. Failing to understand it blinds us to the revolutionary transformations in societies happening all around us.

4.title: How the Negro National League Was Formed | Field of Dreams...Deferred
4.subtitle: The Negro National League debuted 100 years ago with world-class players and legions of fans. Hear how founder Rube Foster formed the league in Part 1 of "Field of Dreams...Deferred," a four-part series from TBS.

4.title: Racist abuse directed at England players after Euro 2020 final
4.subtitle: The online racial abuse of some England players following Sunday's Euro 2020 final defeat by Italy has been described by the team's manager Gareth Southgate as "unforgivable" and "just not what we stand for." Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Bukayo Saka were targeted on social media after they missed penalties in the 3-2 shootout defeat at Wembley Stadium.

5.title: 57 Chocolate
5.subtitle: 57 is the pioneer bean to bar chocolate business in Ghana. ’57 Chocolate is short for 1957, which is the year of Ghana’s independence. This venture uses resources grown within the country to create delicious treats.

products.name: Chocolate Chips
products.description: Get them in dark chocolate (71.5%) or milk chocolate (49%)

products.name: Adinkra Bars
products.description: Our Adinkra bars are beautiful bite-sized bars engraved with visual symbols originally created by the Ashanti of Ghana. A minimum of 2 chocolates and a maximum of 6 fit in our adinkra boxes. They are perfect for a quick treat and come in dark, milk, white, mocha latte, bissap, and moringa.

products.name: Chocolate Gift Box
products.description: Get a set of 6 or 12 bars to give as a gift to the chocolate-lover in your life.

5.title: The Collective PAC
5.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

6.title: Timeline of investigation into Tyre Nichols' death should be the "blueprint"
6.subtitle: Civil rights attorney Ben Crump says the investigation and action Memphis took in the wake of the death of Tyre Nichols should be how all cases involving police brutality are handled.

6.title: 360 Magazine
6.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

7.title: Ava DuVernay's "13th"
7.subtitle: In this thought-provoking documentary, scholars, activists and politicians analyze the criminalization of African Americans and the U.S. prison boom.

7.title: Racism has a cost for everyone
7.subtitle: Racism makes our economy worse — and not just in ways that harm people of color, says public policy expert Heather C. McGhee. From her research and travels across the US, McGhee shares startling insights into how racism fuels bad policymaking and drains our economic potential — and offers a crucial rethink on what we can do to create a more prosperous nation for all.

8.title: Vera Institute of Justice
8.subtitle: Vera is powered by hundreds of advocates, researchers, and activists working to transform the criminal legal and immigration systems until they’re fair for all. Founded in 1961 to advocate for alternatives to money bail in New York City, Vera is now a national organization that partners with impacted communities and government leaders for change.

8.title: Microaggressions Matter
8.subtitle: They may not always be ill-intentioned, but the slights illuminate deeper problems in America.

9.title: First police report in Tyre Nichols case does not match video
9.subtitle: An initial police report filed in the hours after the Tyre Nichols traffic stop suggested he was violent and made claims that were contradicted by video later released by police.

9.title: How we're priming some kids for college — and others for prison
9.subtitle: In the United States, two institutions guide teenagers on the journey to adulthood: college and prison. Sociologist Alice Goffman spent six years in a troubled Philadelphia neighborhood and saw first-hand how teenagers of African-American and Latino backgrounds are funneled down the path to prison — sometimes starting with relatively minor infractions. In an impassioned talk she asks, "Why are we offering only handcuffs and jail time?"

10.title: Alter Planning Co.
10.subtitle:
Alter Planning Co was founded by scottie., a young artist and entrepreneur who grew tired of looking for the perfect planner every year. She crafted each product to help fuel the creativity and productivity of those who used it. 

As an artist, scottie. has a deep understanding of the need for structure and wants to inspire more people to create routines and form in their life.

10.title: Black on Black
10.subtitle: Black On Black™ is beautifully designed clothing & accessories that are both clothing line AND protest sign. Black On Black™ is a social protest on clothing that De:Constructs the Construct.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T
products.description: Juneteenth is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.  Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.

11.title: What Happened in Kenosha, WI?
11.subtitle: Cellphone video of the incident shows police officers in Kenosha, Wisconsin shooting a Black man multiple times on August 23 as he tried to get into a vehicle. Read more about the incident and the protests that followed here.

11.title: Afro Flow Yoga
11.subtitle:
With over 14 years of experience, Leslie Salmon Jones continues to pursue an active interdisciplinary career in health and dance in Boston and New York City. A Toronto native, Leslie received her B.A. in Dance and Health Studies at the State University of New York, and her Fitness Instructors Certification at New York University. She was a scholarship recipient at the esteemed Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre in New York City as well as the London Contemporary Dance School.

As a professional dancer, Leslie worked with known greats such as Judith Jameson, Bill T. Jones and Wynton Marsalis. At her studio in New York, she developed her own exercise program based on various techniques honed through working with her personal training clientele on a daily basis. Today she continues to divide her time between New York City and Boston.

Leslie has extensive experience in the fitness industry, including being a consultant for the New York Knicks healthy lifestyle clinic that teaches self-esteem to youth. She also served as a board member for the organization, Free Arts for Abused Kids, NYC. Today, she serves as a board member of the United Nations Association of New York

12.title: Support the Equal Justice Initiative
12.subtitle: Your contribution is critical to efforts to end mass incarceration and excessive punishment in the United States, challenge racial and economic injustice, and protect the basic human rights for the most vulnerable people in American society.

12.title: 22 Maps & Charts Explaining Mass Incarceration
12.subtitle: America is number one — in incarceration. Over the past several decades, the country has built the largest prison population in the entire world, with the second-highest prison population per capita behind the tiny African country of Seychelles. But how did it get this way?

13.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
13.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

13.title: Me and White Supremacy
13.subtitle: Based on the viral Instagram challenge that captivated participants worldwide, Me and White Supremacy takes readers on a 28-day journey, complete with journal prompts, to do the necessary and vital work that can ultimately lead to improving race relations.

14.title: #ChooseToChallenge - International Women's Day
14.subtitle: A challenged world is an alert world. Individually, we're all responsible for our own thoughts and actions - all day, every day. We can all choose to challenge and call out gender bias and inequality. We can all choose to seek out and celebrate women's achievements. Collectively, we can all help create an inclusive world. From challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge.

14.title: CurlyCoilyTresses
14.subtitle: At CurlyCoilyTresses, we create products that help soothe scalps and moisturize and hydrate hair. We've helped thousands just like you to lengthen and strengthen their hair; soften, moisturize and hydrate their hair; and improve the overall appearance of their hair.

15.title: Justice for Dominique Fells
15.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

15.subtitle: All of our quality brushes are great brushes! They aren't just great for 360 waves. They, too, promote healthy hair in men, women and children, as well as healthy beards.

16.title: Very Puzzled
16.subtitle: As a parent it can be quite challenging to find items such as books and toys that are representative of the diverse society that we live in.  It is important that children see other people that look different to themselves in the books and toys that they interact with to ensure that they appreciate their own heritage and respect the heritage and culture of others.

products.name: 100 piece Africa Map Giant Jigsaw Puzzle
products.description: Puzzles are really great way for you and your extended family to bond with a child.  The very puzzled Africa Map Puzzle is definitely something that you can get stuck into that is rewarding with 100 pieces and each country on the continent of Africa is represented with a variety of landmarks, monuments and attractions it will provide endless fun and topics of discussion that can be used as fun way to learn for both children and adults.

17.title: Harriet Tubman - Biography
17.subtitle: Harriet Tubman was an escaped enslaved woman who became a "conductor" on the Underground Railroad, leading enslaved people to freedom before the Civil War, all while carrying a bounty on her head. But she was also a nurse, a Union spy and a women’s suffrage supporter.

18.title: Harrison Blake Apparel
18.subtitle: Harrison Blake Apparel has found a way to deliver high quality men's accessories at a great price. The style and variety of products are sure to please any gentleman.

products.name: Mandarin Dot Necktie
products.description: A great cotton necktie - in a beautiful design and color scheme = priceless! Grab yours now. Get compliments later...

products.name: Mauve Blossom Pocket Square

products.name: 4 Layer Beet Bracelet
products.description: The perfect bracelet can add the finishing touch to your outfit. The smallest details often say the most. Add this stylish accessory to your collection.

18.title: Two more cis Black women banned from Olympics for their natural testosterone levels
18.subtitle: Christine Mboma and Beatrice Masilingi are the latest accomplished athletes to be excluded under the rule that devastated Caster Semenya's career.

19.title: Coral Oral
19.subtitle: Not only are these toothbrushes more aesthetically pleasing, you differentiate each brush by its pattern and not by its color. Our company is proudly black owned and highlights oral health facts including a Black history fact that we all should know!

products.name: Medium 4-Pack

products.name: Medium Single-Pack

19.title: Justice for Tete Gulley
19.subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

20.title: Reopen Sandra Bland's Case
20.subtitle: Sandra Bland was arrested for a traffic stop on July 10, 2015 by Brian Encinia.  She was found dead in her cell three days later. Encinia was never indicted, in spite of the fact, that he physically assaulted her her on camera. There is a new video that has come to light, which may have been hidden from the grand jury.

20.title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
20.subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.

21.title: "ABC I Love Me"
21.subtitle: ABC I Love Me takes Black children along for a journey of self love, confidence, and adventure while teaching young learners positive affirmations for each letter of the alphabet. This book encourages children to accept their unique qualities, and promotes positive self-esteem and a healthy lifestyle.

21.title: Innocence Project
21.subtitle: Donate to help free the innocent. The Innocence Project exonerates the wrongly convicted through DNA testing and reforms the criminal justice system to prevent future injustices.

22.title: John Hope - Biography
22.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

22.title: POWERHANDZ
22.subtitle: POWERHANDZ is a global company that manufactures unique skill development products used by thousands of professional and youth athletes in multiple sports.

products.name: Basketball Gift Set
products.description: Set includes POWERHANDZ Gloves, DribbleSleeve, Wristband, and Bag

products.name: Football Gift Set
products.description: Set includes POWERHANDZ Gloves, Wristband, and Bag.

products.name: POWERHANDZ Resistance Bands and Sliders
products.description: Set includes 5 resistance bands, 2 sliding disks, and a bag for storage.

23.title: TGEU International Women’s Day - Inclusivity Media Statement
23.subtitle: On the occasion of the International Women’s Day (IWD) on 8 March, TGEU joins the voices of trans people around the world in denouncing oppression, violence, and hate against women and non-binary people in all spheres of life.

23.title: The Words of Martin Luther King Jr. Reverberate in a Tumultuous Time
23.subtitle: Dr. King’s speeches have particular resonance today amid a year of sickness and death, Black Lives Matter protests and the storming of the Capitol.

24.title: Soul Cap
24.subtitle: Haircare for the volume-blessed. Being blessed with voluminous hair shouldn’t come with the curse of harsh chemicals or mediocre products.

24.title: The Hate U Give
24.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

25.title: Lyfestyle Clothing
25.subtitle: It’s our goal to produce quality clothing that embodies our inspirations of the moment. We only source premium fabrics, usually directly from NYC's garment district. All of our cut and sewn garments are made at our Brooklyn factory. We strive to build a strong brand by consistently making quality clothing that our customers can be proud to wear.

products.name: Taffy Multicolor Lyfestyle Sweatsuit
products.description: Chenille Patch. True to Size. Made in Brooklyn. Available in other colors.

products.name: Multicolor Turtleneck Lyfestyle Dresses
products.description: Chenille Patch. 94.5% Rayon / 5.5% Spandex. Fitted. Sewn in Brooklyn

products.name: Serpent Lyfestyle Hoody
products.description: 8oz Mid-Weight Fleece. Velvet Print. True to Size. Printed in Brooklyn

25.title: Perfect Blue Alchemy
25.subtitle: Perfect Blue Alchemy is handcrafted organic, vegan and natural perfumes, body products and home items made from organic essential oils and organic plant oils.

products.name: Elevate Body Butter
products.description: This isn't your run of the mill basic body butter. Blended here is the magic of raw, unrefined shea butter, coconut oil, babassu and tamanu oils with soothing arrowroot and our Elevate fragrance you know and love. Glow different!

products.name: The Essentials Kit
products.description: Everyone can benefit from essential oils in the home. We offer you The Essentials Kit - a kit of 3 of the most widely used essential oils, organic of course, to use in your home diffuser or oil-capable humidifier, in the shower and bath and more.

products.name: Vestige Cologne
products.description: Vestige is our premier men's fragrance, incorporating a delicious blend of Sandalwood, Pine, Basil, Orange and Fir essential oils. Vestige uplifts, excites and inspires fresh perspective.

26.title: Revisionist History: Miss Buchanan’s Period of Adjustment
26.subtitle: Revisionist History is a podcast from Malcolm Gladwell and Pushkin Industries.In this episode: A landmark Supreme Court case. A civil rights revolution. Why has everyone forgotten what happened next?

26.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
26.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

27.title: Hair: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
27.subtitle: John Oliver discusses the importance of Black hair, the ways it can be a target of discrimination, and some ideas to address that.

27.title: 210 Teas
27.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

28.title: Plum Good
28.subtitle: Plum Good locally produces, discriminately sources and proudly brings to market the highest quality culinary and restorative spices, herbs and tea blends available. Our mission is to help bring flavorful nutrition available to our customers.  We make All Natural rubs and blends, teas, jams and sauces.

products.name: Paprika Lime Blend
products.description: This SALT FREE blend of citrus, paprika, garlic, and lime gives color, zest, and mouth watering flavor to fish, chicken, and poultry.

products.name: Organic Chai Tea
products.description: Black Tea, Ginger, Cardamom, Cloves, Peppercorns Cinnamon

products.name: Sweet & Hot Chocolate Sauce
products.description: A culinary gourmet delight for cooks and foodies alike! Choice serrano and chocolate peppers, dark chocolate, balsamic vinegar, raw sugar, cardamom and water make a mouthwatering marinade, topping or accompaniment and make everything it comes into contact with delicious.

28.title: Why Seeing Yourself Represented on Screen Is So Important
28.subtitle: "Black Panther" has been hailed as a model success story for depicting diversity on screen. According to past research, the representation of minority groups in mass media has a powerful educational impact on audiences.

29.title: AllGoudes & Services
29.subtitle: Whether you have a college degree and are seeking to make your first steps onto your career path, or just looking to secure steady income by obtaining an entry level position; AllGoudes and Services makes sure that you’ll be ALLGOUDE in your job search! It’s your time! Let us help you display your worth to potential employers.

29.title: Kultured Misfits
29.subtitle: Kultured Misfits is a lifestyle, sport and ready-to-wear brand based out of Atlanta, Georgia. With a heavy influence from culture found in music, film, and art, we are driven to create timeless work by portraying an aesthetic that is uniquely our own to impact our everyday life.

products.name: Kultured Misfits Tracksuit (Crew + Joggers)
products.description: Classic Kultured Misfits tracksuIt set with matching crewneck and jogger pants in black. A comfortable cotton mix jogger, featuring embroidered Kultured Misfits logo on the left chest and thigh. Drawstring waist and cuffed hems.

products.name: Legalize Free College (Do Tha Right Thang) T-Shirt
products.description: Every sale of a Legalize Free College product will contribute to the "Legalize Free College Scholarship"!

products.name: MISFIT Embossed Crewneck
products.description: Premium crewneck is cut from French terry jersey. With the embossed cursive logo adds a signature finishing touch to its classic design.

30.title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
30.subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

30.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
30.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

31.title: Remembering Henry Lewis, first Black conductor of a major symphony orchestra
31.subtitle: Henry Lewis’ love and passion for music and symphony was indescribable.

31.title: The police who killed Tyre Nichols were Black. But they might still have been driven by racism
31.subtitle: CNN's Van Jones puts his thoughts to paper in this opinion piece in the role racism played in the killing of Tyre Nichols at the hands of 5 Black police officers in Memphis.
